semantic_title: Required Code Ranges for Diagnoses, Symptoms, and Conditions
section_path: Section I > B. General Coding Guidelines > 3. Code or codes from A00.0 through T88.9, Z00-Z99.8, U00-U85

content.full_text: The appropriate code or codes from A00.0 through T88.9, Z00-Z99.8, and U00-U85 must be used to identify diagnoses, symptoms, conditions, problems, complaints or other reason(s) for the encounter/visit. (Evidence: pg no: 13, L34-L37)
content.summary: Specifies the mandatory code ranges that must be used for all diagnoses, symptoms, conditions, problems, complaints, or other reasons for healthcare encounters. (Evidence: pg no: 13, L34-L37)
key_concepts: Mandatory code ranges for all healthcare encounters (Evidence: pg no: 13, L34-L35)
Covers diagnoses, symptoms, conditions, problems, and complaints (Evidence: pg no: 13, L36-L37)
Includes three distinct code ranges: A00.0-T88.9, Z00-Z99.8, and U00-U85 (Evidence: pg no: 13, L35)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Must use codes from A00.0 through T88.9, Z00-Z99.8, and U00-U85 for all encounter reasons (Evidence: pg no: 13, L35-L37)
detailed_rules.explanation: This is a mandatory requirement that establishes the universe of acceptable ICD-10-CM codes for reporting any reason for a healthcare encounter, whether it's a definitive diagnosis, symptom, condition, problem, or complaint (Evidence: pg no: 13, L35-L37)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify the reason for the encounter/visit
Step 2: Ensure the selected code falls within A00.0-T88.9, Z00-Z99.8, or U00-U85 ranges
Step 3: Assign the appropriate code from these ranges

code_ranges.description: Primary range for diseases, injuries, and external causes (Evidence: pg no: 13, L35)
code_ranges.requirement: Must be used for appropriate diagnoses and conditions
usage_rules: Covers most disease conditions and injuries (Evidence: pg no: 13, L35-L37)

code_ranges.description: Factors influencing health status and contact with health services (Evidence: pg no: 13, L35)
code_ranges.requirement: Must be used for encounters not related to current illness or injury
usage_rules: Used for preventive care, follow-up visits, and other health service contacts (Evidence: pg no: 13, L35-L37)

code_ranges.description: Codes for special purposes (Evidence: pg no: 13, L35)
code_ranges.requirement: Must be used when applicable for special circumstances
usage_rules: Reserved for special coding situations as defined by WHO and CMS (Evidence: pg no: 13, L35-L37)

step_by_step: Step 1: Identify chest pain as the reason for encounter
Step 2: Locate appropriate code within A00.0-T88.9 range
Step 3: Assign specific chest pain code

correct_coding.rationale: Chest pain falls within the required A00.0-T88.9 range for symptoms (Evidence: pg no: 13, L35-L37)

incorrect_coding.code: Any code outside A00.0-T88.9, Z00-Z99.8, U00-U85
incorrect_coding.rationale: Would violate the mandatory range requirement
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using codes outside the specified ranges

warnings: All encounter reasons must use codes from the specified ranges (Evidence: pg no: 13, L35-L37)
best_practices: Always verify code falls within required ranges before assignment (Evidence: pg no: 13, L35-L37)
common_mistakes: Using codes outside the mandatory ranges (Evidence: pg no: 13, L35-L37)
tips: Remember all three ranges: A00.0-T88.9, Z00-Z99.8, and U00-U85 (Evidence: pg no: 13, L35)
implementation_notes: This applies to all types of healthcare encounters
clinical_context: Covers all reasons for healthcare encounters
